## SDQ vs AISS

Comparing 'The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire' (SDQ) and 'Arnett's Inventory of Sensation Seeking' (AISS) can be a daunting task, especially across languages. In examining SDQ vs AISS, researchers are often faced with the challenge of finding matches and correlating items within the questionnaires. 

## Compare the items in SDQ and AISS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and AISS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AISS into Harmony</a> - compare AISS with other instruments

Harmony employs advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to conduct comparative studies of SDQ vs AISS. The tool provides a percentage match between each item in SDQ and AISS making the research process more efficient and less repetitive. This way, psychologists are equipped with a platform for a side-by-side comparison of the two questionnaires.
